description.narrative: IR 2.2 Early Childhood Development Increased ECD attendance in community based ECD centres meeting minimum standards for boys and girls aged 3-5 who are from priority marginalized communities increases from 31,300 to 145,000 through UNICEF support,which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Early Learning, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Immunization, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: PCR 2 Keep Children LearningImproved education quality and learning outcomes using an equitable and inclusive approach with a focus on girls' education

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 9 George Street PO Box 7047 Kampala

sector.narrative: Capacity development of ECD frontline workers
Provision of (formal and non-formal) early-learning / pre-primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of early learning / pre-primary education teacher training
Provision of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) teacher training
System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary policy, leadership, and budget
System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary standards and governance
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

title.narrative: Uganda United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Uganda 2018 Annual Report on Results for Children
Uganda 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Uganda 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR 2.2 Early Childhood Development Increased ECD attendance in community based ECD centres meeting minimum standards for boys and girls aged 3-5 who are from priority marginalized communities increases from 31,300 to 145,000 through UNICEF support
Number of parish chiefs collecting ECD data in target districts

baseline.value: 0 Parish chiefs in 15 districts collecting ECD data

target.value: 2015:2900 parish chiefs in 28 districts collecting ECD data

actual.value: 2015:357 parish chiefs are collecting and reporting on ECD

title.narrative: Number of ECD centres with trained caregivers and CMCs in target districts

actual.value: 2015:919 centres have trained and certified early childhood development personnel

title.narrative: Number of ECD centres certified by MoES in target districts

target.value: 2015:2900 community based centres registered by MoES

actual.value: 2015:953 ECD centers to obtain government licenses to operate
